Description: The type of the organization selected from a controlled vocabulary: single-company corporation, multinational, not-for-profit, alliance, consortium, institute, department, working party, project, etc.
Scientific topics that describe the organization and its activities, using a scientific ontology term from EDAM topics.
To record if the organization is still active, and if it were a project or alliance, what the outcome was, or if it has closed down or merged, why and when.
A description of how the organization is funded.
Defines a membership category and associated fees (for projects and alliances, etc).
Keywords to describe the organization. Use term which are not available in EDAM Scientific Topic; use text keywords or ontology terms from other ontologies which could complement EDAM topics.
The date the organization was originally founded. If created through a merger, this should be the foundation date of the purchasing organization.
For an alliance or collaboration or project, the founding members.
The annual (or total - for a project) budget for the organization.
Any files or related websites which give more information about this organization (e.g. flyers, third party sites, etc).
Link to social media websites like Twitter or Facebook.
Date when the organization information was last modified.
